title: Bank of China contributes to $600 million syndicated term loan to Investec for general corporate and refinancing purposes in March 2021 (Linked to Project ID#92678 and #92679)
description: On March 19, 2021, Investec Bank Limited (“Investec”) and a group of 29 banks signed a $600 million syndicated term loan facility for general corporate and refinancing purposes. The loan had two tranches. Tranche A had a 1 year maturity (with the option of a 1-year extension). Tranche B had a 2 year maturity (with the option of a 1-year extension). Project #92677 records BOC’s contribution; Project #92678 records ICBC’s contribution; and Project #92679 records CCB’s contribution.  Coordinators, Bookrunners and Mandated Lead Arrangers included Bank of America; Industrial and Commercial Bank of China Limited, London Branch; Intesa Sanpaolo Bank; SMBC Bank International plc; Standard Chartered Bank; and State Bank of India. Mandated Lead Arrangers included Bank of Baroda; Bank of China; Banco BAI Europa S.A.; BNP Paribas S.A.; China Construction Bank Corporation, Johannesburg Branch; Citibank N.A., London Branch; JP Morgan Securities plc; Lloyds Bank Corporate Markets plc; The National Bank of Ras Al Khaimah (P.S.C.); Abu Dhabi Commercial Bank PJSC; Credit Europe Bank N.V.; Erste Group Bank AG; First Abu Dhabi Bank PJSC; HSBC Bank plc – Johannesburg Branch; and Union Bank of India, Hong Kong Branch. Lead Arrangers includedBank of Taiwan, South Africa Branch; Bayerische Landesbank; AfrAsia Bank Limited; MUFG Bank, Ltd.; Unicredit S.p.A.; the Export-Import Bank of the Republic of China; DZ BANK AG Deutsche Zentral-Genossenschaftsbank, Frankfurt am Main; and KEB Hana Bank.
staff_comments: 1. The individual contributions of Bank of China, ICBC, China Construction Bank are unknown. For the time being, AidData assumes equal contributions ($20,689,655) across the 29 banks that contributed to the $600 million syndicated loan. 2. It is unclear for which tranche the Chinese banks provided financing. Therefore, AidData assumes the maturity rate as the average value of the two (1.5 years).3. Investec is an Anglo-South African international banking and wealth management group. It provides a range of financial products and services to a client base in Europe, Southern Africa, and Asia-Pacific. Investec is dual-listed on the London Stock Exchange and the Johannesburg Stock Exchange.
combined_text:
# Sector
BANKING AND FINANCIAL SERVICES

# Title
Bank of China contributes to $600 million syndicated term loan to Investec for general corporate and refinancing purposes in March 2021 (Linked to Project ID#92678 and #92679)

# Description
On March 19, 2021, Investec Bank Limited (“Investec”) and a group of 29 banks signed a $600 million syndicated term loan facility for general corporate and refinancing purposes. The loan had two tranches. Tranche A had a 1 year maturity (with the option of a 1-year extension). Tranche B had a 2 year maturity (with the option of a 1-year extension). Project #92677 records BOC’s contribution; Project #92678 records ICBC’s contribution; and Project #92679 records CCB’s contribution.  Coordinators, Bookrunners and Mandated Lead Arrangers included Bank of America; Industrial and Commercial Bank of China Limited, London Branch; Intesa Sanpaolo Bank; SMBC Bank International plc; Standard Chartered Bank; and State Bank of India. Mandated Lead Arrangers included Bank of Baroda; Bank of China; Banco BAI Europa S.A.; BNP Paribas S.A.; China Construction Bank Corporation, Johannesburg Branch; Citibank N.A., London Branch; JP Morgan Securities plc; Lloyds Bank Corporate Markets plc; The National Bank of Ras Al Khaimah (P.S.C.); Abu Dhabi Commercial Bank PJSC; Credit Europe Bank N.V.; Erste Group Bank AG; First Abu Dhabi Bank PJSC; HSBC Bank plc – Johannesburg Branch; and Union Bank of India, Hong Kong Branch. Lead Arrangers includedBank of Taiwan, South Africa Branch; Bayerische Landesbank; AfrAsia Bank Limited; MUFG Bank, Ltd.; Unicredit S.p.A.; the Export-Import Bank of the Republic of China; DZ BANK AG Deutsche Zentral-Genossenschaftsbank, Frankfurt am Main; and KEB Hana Bank.
justification: Project involves financial services with no clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Syndicated term loan for general corporate and refinancing purposes, no specific energy or environmental components mentioned

ICBC contributes to $600 million syndicated term loan to Investec for general corporate and refinancing purposes in March 2021 (Linked to Project ID#92677 and #92679)

On March 19, 2021, Investec Bank Limited (“Investec”) and a group of 29 banks signed a $600 million syndicated term loan facility for general corporate and refinancing purposes. The loan had two tranches. Tranche A had a 1 year maturity (with the option of a 1-year extension). Tranche B had a 2 year maturity (with the option of a 1-year extension). Project #92677 records BOC’s contribution; Project #92678 records ICBC’s contribution; Project #92679 records CCB’s contribution.   Coordinators, Bookrunners and Mandated Lead Arrangers included Bank of America; Industrial and Commercial Bank of China Limited, London Branch; Intesa Sanpaolo Bank; SMBC Bank International plc; Standard Chartered Bank; and State Bank of India. Mandated Lead Arrangers included Bank of Baroda; Bank of China; Banco BAI Europa S.A.; BNP Paribas S.A.; China Construction Bank Corporation, Johannesburg Branch; Citibank N.A., London Branch; JP Morgan Securities plc; Lloyds Bank Corporate Markets plc; The National Bank of Ras Al Khaimah (P.S.C.); Abu Dhabi Commercial Bank PJSC; Credit Europe Bank N.V.; Erste Group Bank AG; First Abu Dhabi Bank PJSC; HSBC Bank plc – Johannesburg Branch; and Union Bank of India, Hong Kong Branch. Lead Arrangers includedBank of Taiwan, South Africa Branch; Bayerische Landesbank; AfrAsia Bank Limited; MUFG Bank, Ltd.; Unicredit S.p.A.; the Export-Import Bank of the Republic of China; DZ BANK AG Deutsche Zentral-Genossenschaftsbank, Frankfurt am Main; and KEB Hana Bank.

combined_text:
# Sector
BANKING AND FINANCIAL SERVICES

# Title
CCB contributes to $600 million syndicated term loan to Investec for general corporate and refinancing purposes in March 2021 (Linked to Project ID#92677 and #92678)

# Description
On March 19, 2021, Investec Bank Limited (“Investec”) and a group of 29 banks signed a $600 million syndicated term loan facility for general corporate and refinancing purposes. The loan had two tranches. Tranche A had a 1 year maturity (with the option of a 1-year extension). Tranche B had a 2 year maturity (with the option of a 1-year extension). Project #92677 records BOC’s contribution; Project #92678 records ICBC’s contribution; Project #92679 records CCB’s contribution.   Coordinators, Bookrunners and Mandated Lead Arrangers included Bank of America; Industrial and Commercial Bank of China Limited, London Branch; Intesa Sanpaolo Bank; SMBC Bank International plc; Standard Chartered Bank; and State Bank of India. Mandated Lead Arrangers included Bank of Baroda; Bank of China; Banco BAI Europa S.A.; BNP Paribas S.A.; China Construction Bank Corporation, Johannesburg Branch; Citibank N.A., London Branch; JP Morgan Securities plc; Lloyds Bank Corporate Markets plc; The National Bank of Ras Al Khaimah (P.S.C.); Abu Dhabi Commercial Bank PJSC; Credit Europe Bank N.V.; Erste Group Bank AG; First Abu Dhabi Bank PJSC; HSBC Bank plc – Johannesburg Branch; and Union Bank of India, Hong Kong Branch. Lead Arrangers includedBank of Taiwan, South Africa Branch; Bayerische Landesbank; AfrAsia Bank Limited; MUFG Bank, Ltd.; Unicredit S.p.A.; the Export-Import Bank of the Republic of China; DZ BANK AG Deutsche Zentral-Genossenschaftsbank, Frankfurt am Main; and KEB Hana Bank.
justification: Project involves a syndicated loan for general corporate and refinancing purposes without specific environmental or energy transition implications
evidence: Syndicated term loan facility for general corporate and refinancing purposes, no specific project details provided

title: Bank of China contributes to $600 million syndicated, sustainability-linked term loan to Investec for general corporate and refinancing purposes in November 2021 (Linked to #92682, #92683, #92684)
description: On November 18, 2021, Investec Bank Limited (“Investec”) and a group of 22 banks signed a $600 million syndicated, sustainability-linked term loan facility for general corporate and refinancing purposes. The proceeds of the loan are to be used by the borrower for general corporate purposes, including the refinancing of a $500,000,000 syndicated term loan facility that the borrower signed on November 17, 2020. This loan is the first sustainability-linked syndicated loan ever signed by Investec Bank Limited and the second for the Investec Group. The loan has a 2 year maturity (with the option of a 1-year extension).   Coordinators, Bookrunners and Mandated Lead Arrangers include Abu Dhabi Commercial Bank PJSC; Bank of America; Industrial and Commercial Bank of China Limited, London Branch; SMBC Bank International plc; Standard Chartered Bank; and State Bank of India. Mandated Lead Arrangers included the Export-Import Bank of China; BNP Paribas S.A.; Canara Bank; China Construction Bank Corporation, Johannesburg Branch; Citibank N.A., London Branch; Commerzbank Aktiengesellschaft, Filiale Luxembourg; Credit Europe Bank N.V.; HSBC Bank plc – Johannesburg Branch; JP Morgan Securities plc; Lloyds Bank Corporate Markets plc; Mizuho Corporate Bank; MUFG Bank, Ltd; and the National Bank of Ras Al Khaimah (P.S.C.). Lead Arrangers included Bank of China; Bank of Taiwan, South Africa Branch; and the Export-Import Bank of the Republic of China. Bank of America acted as Documentation Agent and Commerzbank Aktiengesellschaft, Filiale Luxembourg acted as Facility Agent. Bank of China’s contribution is recorded in #92681; China Eximbank’s contribution is recorded in #92682, ICBC’s contribution is recorded in #92683, and CCB’s contribution is recorded in #92684.
staff_comments: 1. The individual contributions of Bank of China, ICBC, China Construction Bank, and China Exim Bank are unknown. For the time being, AidData assumes equal contributions ($27,272,727) across the 22 banks that contributed to the $600 million syndicated loan. 2. Investec is an Anglo-South African international banking and wealth management group. It provides a range of financial products and services to a client base in Europe, Southern Africa, and Asia-Pacific. Investec is dual-listed on the London Stock Exchange and the Johannesburg Stock Exchange.
combined_text:
# Sector
BANKING AND FINANCIAL SERVICES

# Title
Bank of China contributes to $600 million syndicated, sustainability-linked term loan to Investec for general corporate and refinancing purposes in November 2021 (Linked to #92682, #92683, #92684)

# Description
On November 18, 2021, Investec Bank Limited (“Investec”) and a group of 22 banks signed a $600 million syndicated, sustainability-linked term loan facility for general corporate and refinancing purposes. The proceeds of the loan are to be used by the borrower for general corporate purposes, including the refinancing of a $500,000,000 syndicated term loan facility that the borrower signed on November 17, 2020. This loan is the first sustainability-linked syndicated loan ever signed by Investec Bank Limited and the second for the Investec Group. The loan has a 2 year maturity (with the option of a 1-year extension).   Coordinators, Bookrunners and Mandated Lead Arrangers include Abu Dhabi Commercial Bank PJSC; Bank of America; Industrial and Commercial Bank of China Limited, London Branch; SMBC Bank International plc; Standard Chartered Bank; and State Bank of India. Mandated Lead Arrangers included the Export-Import Bank of China; BNP Paribas S.A.; Canara Bank; China Construction Bank Corporation, Johannesburg Branch; Citibank N.A., London Branch; Commerzbank Aktiengesellschaft, Filiale Luxembourg; Credit Europe Bank N.V.; HSBC Bank plc – Johannesburg Branch; JP Morgan Securities plc; Lloyds Bank Corporate Markets plc; Mizuho Corporate Bank; MUFG Bank, Ltd; and the National Bank of Ras Al Khaimah (P.S.C.). Lead Arrangers included Bank of China; Bank of Taiwan, South Africa Branch; and the Export-Import Bank of the Republic of China. Bank of America acted as Documentation Agent and Commerzbank Aktiengesellschaft, Filiale Luxembourg acted as Facility Agent. Bank of China’s contribution is recorded in #92681; China Eximbank’s contribution is recorded in #92682, ICBC’s contribution is recorded in #92683, and CCB’s contribution is recorded in #92684.
justification: The project is a financial service with no direct environmental impact or energy transition implications
evidence: Syndicated sustainability-linked term loan for general corporate and refinancing purposes, no specific environmental projects mentioned

staff_comments: 1. The individual contributions of Bank of China, ICBC, China Construction Bank, and China Exim Bank are unknown. evidence: Sustainability-linked term loan for general corporate and refinancing purposes, no specific environmental projects mentioned

title: Chinese Embassy provides R 114,000 to 39 students and faculty in South Africa in December 2021
description: On December 7, 2021, the Chinese Embassy in South Africa provided 114,00 Rand in prize money to 39 student and faculty recipients of the “China Ambassador Award” in South Africa. The funds were given to the Department of Basic Education of South Africa for distribution to the recipients. These funds were provided in order to improve basic education services in South Africa.  An award handover ceremony was held for this donation at the Chinese Embassy in South Africa. China’s Ambassador to South Africa, Chen Xiaodong, South Africa’s Minister of Basic Education, Mrs. Motshekga, and South Africa’s Deputy Director of Basic Education, Mr. Padayachee, attended the ceremony. Award recipients, both faculty and students, also attended the ceremony and delivered speeches.

title: Chinese Embassy and Chinese Consulate General jointly provide 600 food parcels to KwaZulu-Natal (KZN) locals in August 2021
description: On August 11, 2021, the Chinese Embassy and the Chinese Consulate General in Durban provided 600 food parcels to locals in the KwaZulu-Natal (KZN) province of South Africa. This donation was made to alleviate the stress of citizens affected by recent riots throughout the KwaZulu-Natal province. The monetary value of the donation is unknown.  A handover ceremony was held for this donation. China’s Ambassador to South Africa, Chen Xiaodong, the Chinese Consul General in Durban, Fei Mingxing, and representatives of the KZN Provincial government attended the ceremony. At the ceremony, Ambassador Chen Xiaodong handed over the food parcels to the KZN government. The parcels were then distributed to locals by the KZN provincial government.
combined_text:
# Sector
DEVELOPMENTAL FOOD AID/FOOD SECURITY ASSISTANCE

# Title
Chinese Embassy and Chinese Consulate General jointly provide 600 food parcels to KwaZulu-Natal (KZN) locals in August 2021

# Description
On August 11, 2021, the Chinese Embassy and the Chinese Consulate General in Durban provided 600 food parcels to locals in the KwaZulu-Natal (KZN) province of South Africa. This donation was made to alleviate the stress of citizens affected by recent riots throughout the KwaZulu-Natal province. The monetary value of the donation is unknown.  A handover ceremony was held for this donation. China’s Ambassador to South Africa, Chen Xiaodong, the Chinese Consul General in Durban, Fei Mingxing, and representatives of the KZN Provincial government attended the ceremony. At the ceremony, Ambassador Chen Xiaodong handed over the food parcels to the KZN government. The parcels were then distributed to locals by the KZN provincial government.
justification: Project is focused on humanitarian aid and food security, with no direct environmental or energy transition implications
evidence: 600 food parcels provided for citizens affected by riots, social development focus

title: Chinese government provides 50,000 face masks and ZAR 500,000 in food vouchers to the South African Department of Social Development in October 2021
description: On October 19, 2021, the Chinese government provided 50,000 face masks and food vouchers to the South African Department of Social Development. These supplies were donated to improve South Africa’s COVID-19 and food crisis response efforts. The monetary value of the face masks is unknown but the value of the food vouchers is an estimated ZAR 500,000.  A handover ceremony was held for this donation at the Chinese Embassy in Pretoria, South Africa. China’s Ambassador, Chen Xiaodong, South Africa’s Minister of Social Development, Lindiwe Zulu, and the chairperson for the African National Congress’ Subcommittee on International Relations attended the ceremony.
